availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Executive Journal, 1859-1862

body.p:
23
The Governor commissioned W. S. Dehoney captain in the Quarter Masters Department with the Rank of Captain.
He respited for twelve months a judgment of a Justice of the Peace for Franklin county for $30 against William Moore for a breach of the peace
He commissioned the officers of the Enrolled Militia for the county of Johnson (duty elected)

p.hi: He issued commissiones to the officers of the following companies to wit:

body.p: He commissioned the following Justices of the Peace in and for Perry County William Stewart for District No 4 in place of John Holliday, and Roger Carnett in District No 6 in place of Hiram Pratt, removed from district
